name: Moonlander VR
description:
VR game made for a university course at Campus Gotland, Uppsala University.

The goal is to gain points by landing as many times as possible with the amount of fuel provided.

More points are gained by landing on more narrow areas.

3 criteria need to be fullfilled in order to not explode on impact with the ground:

  • The ground you land on has to be completely horizontal, viable areas are marked with an arrow along with the score gained by landing there.
  • The moonlanders legs have to be oriented downwards
  • You have to fall slowly enough (the exact speed is up to you to discover)

The "terrain" is generated at runtime and is remade on every try.

Made in Unity using MRTK (Microsoft Mixed Reality Toolkit).

Tested on an Acer WMR headset through Steam VR, should work with any Windows Mixed Reality headset, and hopefully any VR headset with joystick controllers.

Controls:

  • Joystick X axis to rotate.
  • Trigger to control thruster. Note that the amount of thrust depends on the trigger press amount/depth, but fuel is always consumed at the same rate regardless of amount of thrust.
  • "Grip" button resets and restarts.
